data_maturity_score.evidence: Focus on Palantir Foundry for data pipelines and ontology suggests structured data practices, but no mention of modern data stack tools (dbt, Airflow, Snowflake), CI/CD, or data quality testing. Limited signals of governance or monitoring.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 2 - basic pipelines and platform usage (Foundry) but no advanced practices mentioned.

maturity_signals.evidence: Palantir Foundry is a modern data platform, but no other modern stack tools (dbt, Airflow, etc.) mentioned. No CI/CD, testing, or governance signals.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Role is clearly defined as Software & Data Engineer focused on Palantir Foundry - no conflation with data science, analytics, or DevOps responsibilities.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Startup environment in aerospace/defense with 'accelerate how we design, build, and test' language suggests fast pace, but unlimited PTO and no on-call mentioned mitigate risk.

role_clarity.evidence: Specific responsibilities listed: design pipelines, develop ontology, configure integrations, document data logic - all focused on Foundry platform.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk - well-defined role with clear responsibilities, good benefits (unlimited PTO, equity), but startup pace and security clearance requirement add moderate risk.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions collaborating with Product Owner and other Software & Data Engineers, but no specific manager or reporting line stated.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title or level mentioned in job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Mentions 'growing our internal software capabilities' and 'accelerate how we design, build, and test' suggesting expansion, but no specific growth metrics.

team_composition.evidence: Mentions 'other Software & Data Engineers' but no team size or seniority mix specified.

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure specified in job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions 'collaborate with the Product Owner and stakeholders and users' suggesting embedded work with product teams.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Unlimited PTO, no on-call mentioned, but aerospace/defense startup context may imply pressure. No explicit work-life balance statements.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Equity grants and 'exciting challenges' mentioned, but no learning budget, conference support, or career path clarity. Growth implied but not structured.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Palantir Foundry is modern, but no mention of engineering practices (code review, CI/CD, testing). Focus on manufacturing/IoT data suggests domain-specific challenges.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Only 'agile-inspired development methodologies' mentioned. No code review, CI/CD, monitoring, or other practices specified.

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on implementing tools and processes within Foundry, with no mention of experimentation, R&D, or new tech exploration.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt, refactoring, or code quality improvement initiatives.

ai_integration_level.evidence: No ML/AI mentioned in job posting or Pass 1 extraction. Focus is on data pipelines and ontology within Foundry.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools (SageMaker, MLflow, etc.) mentioned in job posting or Pass 1 extraction.

hiring_urgency.evidence: Posted for minimum of 3 days, 'remain open until filled' - standard hiring timeline with no urgency signals.

competition_level.evidence: Colorado location (less competitive than SF/NYC), but aerospace/defense niche and Palantir Foundry specialization may limit applicant pool. No application count available.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Aerospace/defense startup with 'growing internal software capabilities' and equity grants, suggesting Series A/B stage. No explicit funding mentioned.

hiring_velocity.evidence: Mentions 'growing our internal software capabilities' and 'accelerate how we design, build, and test' suggesting ongoing hiring, but no aggressive expansion signals.

team_size_signals.evidence: Mentions 'other Software & Data Engineers' implying small team (2-5), but no exact size given. Aerospace/defense context suggests lean team.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: Equity grants and growth focus suggest Series A funding, but no explicit funding stage mentioned.

role_creation_type.evidence: Mentions 'growing our internal software capabilities' and 'accelerate how we design, build, and test' suggesting new role created for growth, not backfill.

strengths: Clear, focused role on Palantir Foundry with specific responsibilities
Strong benefits package including unlimited PTO and equity grants
Niche aerospace/defense domain with national security impact
concerns: Limited data maturity signals - no modern stack tools or engineering practices mentioned
US citizenship/permanent residency and security clearance required - restrictive for international candidates
Limited growth path clarity and no innovation/learning culture signals
best_fit_for: Mid-level data engineers (1-5 years) with Palantir Foundry experience
Candidates seeking aerospace/defense domain experience and national security impact
Engineers comfortable with onsite work in Colorado and security clearance requirements
red_flags_to_probe: Ask about actual team size and seniority mix of the data engineering team
Understand the sprint cadence and deadline pressure in aerospace/defense context
Clarify if there are opportunities for skill development beyond Foundry platform
negotiation_leverage: Palantir Foundry expertise is specialized and valuable in aerospace/defense sector
Manufacturing/IoT data experience is a differentiator for this role
Equity grants and unlimited PTO are strong negotiation points
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for mid-level data engineers seeking specialized Palantir Foundry experience in aerospace/defense. Clear role with good benefits, but limited data maturity signals and growth path clarity. Main trade-offs are location requirement, security clearance, and narrow tech stack focus.
